Transcript: Ava: Huh. Missed call. (Phone rings)
Alan-Michael: Hello?

Ava: Hey, it's Ava. Did you just try to call
me? I’m at the airport and my phone was off.

Alan-Michael: You sure you weren't avoiding
me?
Ava: Why would I avoid you?

Alan-Michael: I don't know. (Scoffs) I thought maybe the job offer I messengered over
to you offended you or something because you didn't bother to respond.
Ava: What job offer?
Alan-Michael: Very funny.
Ava: I'm not kidding. What job offer?

Alan-Michael: A new position opened up at
Spaulding. It would be a promotion for you with a big raise. I put it all in
writing and had my new assistant messenger it over to your room. She said you
were in the shower, but she left it with someone else for you. Are you saying
you never got it?
Ava: You did what?

Alan-Michael: So you’re not calling to
accept?
Ava: I gotta go.
Ava: (Sighs) (Boys' Choir singing "O Christmas Tree")
Connie: Are we ready?
Little Ava: Ready!
Connie: I know it's kind of
small, sweetheart.
Little Ava: It's beautiful.
Connie: What did you ask
Santa for?
I'm not sure Santa will be able
to handle a list that big.
Little Ava: Maybe he will!
Connie: Maybe.
But do you know we already have
the best gift ever?
Little Ava: What?
Connie: Each other.
Our family.
I wouldn't trade that for
anything in the world.
Little Ava: Me neither.
Connie: Family is everything, Ava.
Never let it go.
Rick: Ava?
Ava: Hi.

Rick: Hi. Aren't you supposed to be on a
plane right now?
Ava: I couldn't go.
Rick: Oh. So, you and Coop...

Ava: No, just, not tonight. I've had a lot
going on in the last couple of months.
Rick: It must be difficult for you.

Ava: Yeah. Finding out that Jeffrey O’Neill
was my father and that Olivia was my mother, and trying to figure out what to
do with that.
Rick: Take your time. Just take your time.

Ava: Yeah. What they have here... wow, it's
nice.
Rick: Yeah.
Ava: It's really nice.

Rick: It is nice. You know, things may
change us, but it... it starts and ends with family. Sometimes you don't know
that until you've lost it. Hey, you want to come inside? I'm sure Harley
wouldn’t...

Ava: Oh, no. Merry
Christmas.
Rick: Merry Christmas.

Coop: She's not answering. Come on.
"Dear Coop..." come on, Ava, I don't get this. Where are you?
Ava: Mom.

Buzz: Okay, look, I was going to Main Street, you know that jewelry store there, and I was going
to return this, and then suddenly I have an epiphany. I must have lost my mind,
I must be crazy, I mean with you, you make my
pituitary gland, my growth hormones, improve my bone density. You are an
aerobic exercise for me. When you are in the room, my heart beats more and
more. I can’t live without you. So will you please, please, please marry me?
Olivia: Yes, yes, yes.
Buzz: Yes?

Ava: Why don’t you give me something
festive, something with a candy cane. (Laughs)
Man: You like candy canes?

Ava: ‘Tis the season. Man this place is kind
of busy, I didn’t expect that.

Man: Shouldn’t you be home for Christmas
with your family?
Ava: Family? Family is complicated.

Man: (Laughs) Now
that , that is why bars are open on Christmas.
Ava: Yes. (Laughs)
Man: You want to talk about it?
Ava: Do you have all night, cause it’s a long story.
Man: Do I have somewhere else to be tonight?

Ava: Good point. Okay, well you asked for
it. You better get a double of that drink, he needs a double. (Laughs) So, my parents aren’t really my parents, but
that’s not really true, my mother is my mother. She has loved me and raised me
my whole life. Let’s face it, that’s your mother, right?
Man: Even if it’s not your mom.
Ava: Exactly.
Man: So your real mother.

Ava: My real mother.. my real mother and father aren’t the kind of people
you would want to walk an old lady across the street.
Man: Yikes.

Ava: I know. They hate each other. It’s
terrible. I guess I’m a product of that.
Man: No, no, no, no. Don’t say that.

Ava: They didn’t really always hate each
other, to be honest with you, they didn’t actually
know each other when they first met. And that makes things frustrating and not
work. But um, and my boyfriend, who I love with all of my heart, lied to me to
get me to go on a trip with him.
Man: But you didn’t go.

Ava: But I didn’t go, that’s true. This
place has been like my family, it’s been so important to me. It’s all I’ve had
for a long time.
Man: I think that you made the right choice.
Ava: I don’t know what choice that was.
Man: You’re here, here with me.
Ava: Here.

Man: That says a lot. It says that this
could be a great Christmas, you know I did ask Santa
for a beautiful girl.
Ava: Oh.
Man: Here you are.

Ava: Did you tell your wife that you ask
Santa for a beautiful girl? Maybe you shouldn’t drink so much,
you forget that you have a wedding ring on.

Man: Look, it’s
okay really, she doesn’t understand me.

Ava: Yeah, you seem like a really deep guy
to me.

Man: All I’m saying is that what I do, and
what she knows about what I do are two different things.

Ava: You are such a liar,
do you think that you can play with people’s lives like that?

Man: You know what sweetheart,
it’s not really your life that I wanted to play with.
Ava: Okay, I’m out of here.

Man: 
Don’t be such a, come on now.

Ava: Stop it, what are you doing? Let go of
me.

Jeffrey: The lady said back off. So uh,
you’re AWOL, the entire Cooper clan is out in force looking for you, they sent
out the bloodhounds.

Ava: Well, I didn’t mean to scare anybody.
Sorry.

Jeffrey: So how are you, besides nearly
getting attacked in there? Are you okay?

Ava: Well it’s Christmas day and I’m in a
bar.
Jeffrey: Yeah, why aren’t you in England?
Ava: I changed my mind.
Jeffrey: Someone should tell Coop.

Ava: I’ll handle it. Just
like I handled that loser in there. I don’t need you.

Jeffrey: Guys like that only understand one
thing.
Ava: Yeah, you would know.

Jeffrey: So, I heard you made it as far as
the airport and then you disappeared.
Ava: I think it’s time for me to leave.

Jeffrey: Wait, I mean why? You don’t have
to. I’m just...
Ava: You’re just what?

Jeffrey: Well, look if you
are gonna go, let me get you a cab, okay?
Ava: I can walk.

Coop: Wanna walk with me? Ava, I have been
looking everywhere for you.
Ava: I’m sorry.

Coop: Sorry? Okay, Ava, what the hell
happened?
Ava: It doesn’t..
Jeffrey: Ava...

Ava: Just go, would you please go. Please.
Jeffrey, Merry Christmas.
Jeffrey: You too.

Ava: Sorry okay, I didn’t mean to scare you.
I just couldn’t, I couldn’t get on the plane. I couldn’t do it.

Coop: You couldn’t get on the plane, Ava,
why, you couldn’t have told me that? You know I think I deserve some answers
here.

Ava: Oh really? You’ve been the one to have
all the answers lately, right Coop?

Man: If you ask me, I don’t think that she
was worth all of the drama. What was she anyway, your ex or something?

Jeffrey: I think you need to mind your own
business.

Man: Whatever. A piece of trash like that
wasn’t worth my time anyway.
Jeffrey: What did you say?
Man: Nothing, big guy. Nothing.
Jeffrey: That’s what I thought.

Man: I was just wondering why a slut like
that was worth your time. (Laughs)
Jeffrey: That’s it.

Coop: Guess you really didn’t change your
mind.
Ava: Why didn’t you leave without me?

Coop: Ava, what was I gonna do that for?
Huh?
Ava: I don’t know, you have a dream right?

Coop: Yeah, my dream was with you. Ava, this
was supposed to be a trip that was going to start our new life together. This
is what we wanted or at least I thought it was. What happened?

Ava: Alan-Michael offered me a great job
before we left, that’s what happened.
Coop: That is what this is about?

Ava: It is, how about the contract that was
delivered here?

Coop: The contract was delivered here, you
were in the shower.
Ava: The contract that I never saw.

Coop: I know you never got to see it because
I got the contract, read it and then put it in the garbage where it belonged.

Ava: Exactly. Without
telling me about it.

Coop: Ava, you know as well as I do that the
whole thing that Alan-Michael was trying to do was to try to keep you here in
town and he knew that if you thought that he needed you, you would’ve stayed.

Ava: Thank you so very much for your faith
in me, your faith in our relationship.

Coop: Excuse me, I think that I have the
right to try to protect you, protect us and protect everything that we are. I’m
not gonna let anybody or anything step in the way.
Ava: What about what I want?

Coop: You wanted to go away,
you wanted to see the world together. We were gonna go see different places,
meet different people...

Ava: I did. I thought about going away with
you, I did.

Coop: Fine, Springfield is gonna be here, it’s not going anywhere. If we
leave and come back, everything is still gonna be the same. Ava, what I’m
trying to tell you is that this.. Look at me. This
trip was going to be the start of something new. For us to
see what we could do outside of this place. Ava, I wanted to show you so
many new places and so many new things.
Ava: I know.

Coop: So let’s go, let me just change the
tickets, we can get right back on the plane again, let’s just get out of here.
Ava: Coop, I don’t know if I can, I’m sorry.

Coop: You are not gonna regret it. Please
just give it a shot. Trust me please, that’s all I’m asking for.
Ava: I don’t know.

Coop: It’s okay. Let me just change the
tickets, you repack your bag, I’ll take care of everything, we’ll meet right
back here. Please. Ava, look, I love you, I love you so much and I know I
probably don’t say it as much as I should, I need to, but I just really love
you.
Ava: I know.

Coop: Please. Just let me fix all of this
stuff. Whew. I’ll be right back, okay, I promise.
(Phone ringing)
Ava: Hello.
Frank: Ava, it’s Frank.

Ava: He found me. Uh, he actually just left,
but everything is fine.

Frank: This isn’t about Coop,
it’s about your father.
Ava: My what?
Frank: Jeffrey O’Neill.
Ava: What happened, he got arrested, he’s in jail?
Frank: No, he’s at the emergency room at Cedars Hospital. He’s been hurt pretty bad and I think you should come down here.
Ava: Frank, what’s going on?
Frank: He’s in there.

Ava: Oh my God. I don’t understand, I just
saw him and he was fine, has anyone been in here to see him?

Frank: Ava, I didn’t know who else to call.
You want to go in and talk to him?
Ava: Yeah.
Jeffrey: What are you doing here?

Ava: Maybe I should ask you the same
question.
Jeffrey: You shouldn’t be here.

Ava: You sure know how to find trouble,
don’t you.
Jeffrey: Yeah, well, it seems to find me.

Ava: Well, Franks right outside. I hope you
don’t need any money, any kind of bail, because I don’t have a job right now.

Jeffrey: (Laughs)
You should go.

Ava: If you need help, that’s what I’m
trying to say.

Jeffrey: Just go. Okay, please, I don’t want
you here right now.
Ava: Fine. Why did you call me.

Frank: I said I didn’t know who else to
call. The nurse was showing me his personal belongings and there was a package
that had your name on it.
Ava: Did he ask for me

Frank: No. Nurse, can I have that package,
thank you. It’s for you.

Ava: It’s a present for me? I don’t know
what to do with this. He has made it perfectly clear that he does not want to
be my father. Why would he give me...

Frank: Because he’s not an idiot. Ava, come
on, who wouldn’t want you as a daughter.
Ava: Thanks.

Frank: For what it’s worth, my uh, my dad
bailed on me and the family for about 20 years and he never looked back, and I
hated him for a long, long time. But after time, he won me over, and I’m not
sorry...

Man: Hey, I guess your boyfriend is sorry
that he messed with me and my buddies. Just couldn’t leave it alone.
Frank: Get him out of here.
Ava: Jeffrey hurt himself defending me?

Frank: Yeah, unfortunately, that’s the way
it looks, four against one. Maybe you should let him rest,
you know he took a bad beating.

Ava: “Ava, have a happy holiday in jolly old
England, Jeffrey O’Neill.” Oh wow. My
birthstone.

Coop: Ava, you can’t keep disappearing like
this.
Ava: Sorry.
Coop: Did you finish packing?
Ava: Oh, you seemed so excited before you left, I thought maybe you had done it for me.
Coop: Well, I was almost going to, but...you seeing someone behind my back now?
Ava: What? Oh, it’s from Jeffrey.
Coop: You went to see him?

Ava: Actually, your brother gave it to me.
Jeffrey can’t lift his arms, he’s covered head to toe
in bandages. He’s in the hospital. He got into a fight at Outskirts, there were
some guys bothering me and...
Coop: Wow, so you went to the hospital?
Ava: Frank didn’t know who else to call.
Coop: Right. Uh, what did O’Neill say?

Ava: Well, he ask
me to leave, he told me to go.
Coop: Ouch, are you alright?

Ava: I don’t know how I feel about it. He
gets me a gift and then he almost gets killed defending my honor and then tells
me to leave. I mean, why would he get me a gift and then not give it to me?
Coop: It’s because I told him not to.
Ava: What?

Coop: Ava, O’Neill was at the airport. He
wanted to see you and he wanted to bring that gift to you before you left. I
didn’t think it was a good idea for him to see you.
Ava: Really?

Coop: Yes, look, I walked in on Jeffrey and
Olivia having a fight, it was about you, and it was like a tug-of-war. They
were both threatening each other using you as the leverage to try to hurt the other
person. Afterwards, I confronted O’Neill and I ask him if he was going to step
up and be the father that you needed.
Ava: What did he say?

Coop: He didn’t give me an answer, which if
you think about it , is an answer in itself. Ava,
look, I didn’t ask the guy to take off. But seriously, he is not worthy of
being your father. He doesn’t deserve to be. Oh come on, what did I do now?

Ava: None of this was your decision to make
for me.
Coop: None of my decision, Ava, please. I thought I was making the right call for you.

Ava: This is my life, okay, he’s not your
father, he’s my father.
Coop: I thought I was doing the right thing, I was trying to protect you.

Ava: I don’t want protection. Why do you
feel like you need to protect me? Maybe I want to make decisions for myself and
what do you really know?
Coop: I think I know you pretty well.

Ava: You don’t know anything. You just need
to stop what you’re doing, Coop. Stop it or I’m gonna make...

Coop: What? What are you gonna do? Why do I
have to apologize for doing what’s best for you?

Ava: Because maybe you don’t even ask me
what I think is good for me.
Coop: Ava, that’s not...

Ava: You knew that I was adopted, you didn’t
tell me. You turned down this job offer from Alan-Michael and you didn’t tell
me that either.
Coop: It was a crap job.

Ava: Jeffrey came to the airport, you turned
him away.

Coop: No, he could’ve stayed, but you know,
he didn’t, so I was right about that.

Ava: It’s not about what’s right and wrong.
This is about my life.
Coop: A life that we are sharing, Ava.
Ava: Yeah.

Coop: Why are we even fighting right now, we
should be on an airplane right now, in our seats, watching an in-flight movie
with your head on my shoulder.

Ava: Of course. Because you have it all
figured out.

Coop: Fine. Okay, fine. Maybe I can be a
little overbearing and maybe I can come on a little strong, but did you ever thinks it’s because I love you. Huh, did you ever think of
that at all? Why don’t we start over. Maybe we just
need a little bit of time, we can work through this,
Ava.

Ava: My life. I have a lot going on in my
life right now, so much stuff, I can’t even keep focused on something, I can’t
even think.
Coop: Let’s take the time, let’s help you think, let’s do what we have to do, please.
Ava: I want a break.
Coop: Okay, for how long?

Ava: I don’t know. But I want a break, I
need time to myself. (Knock at door) What?

Olivia: I just came by to talk. Hey Coop.
Maybe Coop already told you, but Buzz and I are getting married.
Ava: Congratulations.
Olivia: Really?
Ava: Yeah. Buzz really loves you.

Olivia: He’s a special guy. Coop, do you
mind if Ava and I talk alone?

Coop: Yeah, I got to make a phone call
anyway, so...Don’t go anywhere, okay?

Olivia: He was really upset today when you
left him at the airport.
Ava: What do you want?

Olivia: Well I guess we are all gonna be one
big happy family.
Ava: Right. Yeah

Olivia: Look, I want Buzz to be happy, and I
want a real marriage, one based on love and trust.
Ava: Trust.
Olivia: I do want that.

Ava: I don’t have time for this right now,
Olivia. Give me a break.

Olivia: I’ve been out there in the world and
I been married enough times to know that these Cooper men are like endangered
species, you know. They really aren’t trying to run our lives, they don’t
manipulate, and they don’t want to change you, they just want to love you.
Ava: Yeah.

Olivia: We’re lucky and I’m glad that you
found someone like Coop at your age, you know. You don’t have to make all of
the mistakes that I did. So, can we give it a shot?

Ava: (Laughs)
Sure, why not?

Olivia: Okay. Merry
Christmas.
Coop: Same to you. Are you okay?
Ava: Yeah.

Coop: Yeah, sometimes I wish that we could
star over without your crazy parents in the picture.
Ava: Is that what you really want?

Coop: Yeah. Ava, I enjoyed having you all to
myself. I don’t trust Olivia, I don’t trust Jeffrey, and I certainly do not
trust Alan-Michael.
Ava: Do you trust me?
Coop: Of course I trust you.

Ava: Good, I’m glad, then you’ll trust me,
that you and I need to take a little time apart, before we spend anymore time
as a couple.

Coop: You know I’m not gonna give you up
without fighting, right?
Ava: You don’t have to fight for me.

Coop: Really, because right now, it feels
like I kind of have to.

Ava: You and I, when we got together as a couple,
it was so fast. What about you, what about London, what about Oxford, what about your writing?

Coop: I thought I was starting to live that
dream, remember.
Ava: Yeah. You were, but it wasn’t my dream.
Coop: Ava, you can do whatever you want.
Ava: Can I work for Spaulding?

Coop: I think you know what Alan-Michael
wants from you.

Ava: But it’s not what I want. I need some
air.
(Knocking on door)
Alan-Michael: You’re still here.
Ava: Are you busy?
Alan-Michael: Just give me a second.
Donia: Hi.

Ava: Hi. This is business,
I can always come back if you want me to. It’s not a problem.

Alan-Michael: You know me, business always
comes first. Come on in, Donia was just leaving. Donia, this is the friend I
was telling you about.

Donia: So this is why you were distracted,
you have my number. Merry Christmas.
Alan-Michael: So you didn’t go to England.
Ava: Why don’t you tell me about this job offer.

Alan-Michael: High five figures, you get a
new office, you get to be creative, I’ll give you a small staff, work hard,
show me results, I’ll move you up.
Ava: Are you my boss or is Alexandra?
Alan-Michael: Me.

Ava: Okay. Depending on how you answer the
following questions depends on my decision.
Alan-Michael: Then I’ll answer carefully.
Ava: Am I qualified for the job?
Alan-Michael: Technically no.

Ava: Are you just offering me this job so
you can get me in bed?

Alan-Michael: Yes, but I’m not stupid, I
wouldn’t jeopardize my company. I think you will do a great job.

Ava: You are the first person who hasn’t lied
to me, so yes.

Alan-Michael: Yes, you will sleep with me or
yes you’ll take the job.
Ava: Grow up.

Alan-Michael: Not a chance. Sure you don’t
want to stay, have a little eggnog?
Ava: Did you get me anything?
Alan-Michael: I got you a killer job.
Ava: Oh, I will see you tomorrow.
Alan-Michael: Bright and early.

Ava: Bright and early, I’m not gonna let you
down.
Alan-Michael: I know.

Ava: Thanks for believing in me. You are the
first person in a ling time who hasn’t lied to me.
Alan-Michael: I figured you could handle it.
Marina: You gonna drink all of those or can you share?
Coop: Sure.
Marina: So, did you find Ava?

Coop: Yeah, and you’re right. I pushed her a
little too hard. She wants to have a break.

Marina: So let her have a break. You know,
if you love something, let it go and all that stuff. She’ll find her way back
to you. You’re a catch.
Coop: I’m not really feeling like one.
Frank: All right, beer’s on the house.
Coop: Sure, why not.
Buzz: Not fooled by any of this are you?
Coop: Let’s see, one, two, three, you guys just happen to be here together.
Marina: Just relax and embrace the love.

Frank: Or we could totally get you
plastered.
Coop: Does sound like a plan.
Next on "Guiding Light"...
Reva: Hello, Joshua. Welcome home.

Ava: If you want to do something nice for
me, give me some space.

Lizzie: I need him to let me get his motor
running, or he's going to go somewhere else to fill his tank.

Jonathan: Yeah, I need to see you, too. Can
you get to the Beacon later?
Tammy: See you soon.
